listitem.para: All security updates issued for UCS 4.1-1 are included:

listitem.simpara: Service information files in /etc/univention/service.info/services are now only considered if they carry the filename suffix .cfg. The behavior is now similar to the treatment of UCR info files. (40383).

This update addresses the following issue(s): On UCS systems booting via BIOS, an error would happen if debconf grub-pc/install_devices contains a wrong device. If it contains a wrong device the GRUB installation happens but fails, leading to an inconsistent installation between /boot/grub and the GRUB directly on the disk. This makes the system not bootable.
This update checks all devices in grub-pc/install_devices, removing invalid devices.
Additionally a guess is made for the correct boot device which will be added to grub-pc/install_devices if grub-pc/install_devices is currently empty or there were invalid devices.
If any changes were made, grub-install is run on all devices in grub-pc/install_devices.
See also 1356 and 1357. (40654, 40660).
If error messages contained a "%" they weren't displayed in UMC. This issue has been fixed (40749).
The expiration date has been increased by 5 years. This results in a traceback during the login on the 29th of February. This issue has been fixed (40790).
It's now possible to use multiple languages in one session when using HTTP basic authentication (via command line) (40806).
The umc.store API allows to contain Arrays in query requests now (38639).
An error in the comparsion function umc.tools.cmpObjects which could cause that e.g. sorting the grid header wasn't possible anymore has been fixed (35407).
The location where UMC redirects after logout is now configurable via the &ucsUCRV; umc/logout/location (40613).
The UMC login page does not warn about an insecure connection when logging in from the same machine the UMC runs on (40638).
Error dialogs concerning Piwik are now suppressed (30822).
Ensure that the first non-empty UMC category is shown at startup (40923).
Add a hook interface for other packages for extending the behavior of UMC (40118).
A UMC server crash is prevented which might happen during session timeout (40627).
The property translationId for UMC XML files was previously only evaluated for UMC module flavors. With this update, translationId is also correctly evaluated for module and link entries (40930).
Docker Apps now do not have their repository removed in the container (40315).
Upgrading Apps now does not lead to an error just after the installation of packages (40674).
Upgrading Apps now does not lead to an error when upgrading their master packages (40713).
The application information like vendor, description were HTML encoded twice at some places (35324).
If no package changes are detected an application could not be upgraded (40005).
The error handling of the apps module has been improved (40797).
The application metadata are ensured to be updated before installing or upgrading an application. This prevents errors when installing applications on remote hosts (40804).

Apps may define ports they want to occupy exclusively. Docker Apps checked before installation whether an already installed App excepts exclusive access to one of these ports. This check has been extended to Non-Docker Apps (40508).
Apps now show general information about the terms under which the software may be used. If the App ships a license file, it may be read before and after installation (40428).
Internal adaptations have been added to allow for extending App Center functionalities (40827).
univention-register-apps now uses the new appcenter API and has been deprecated (40754).
An error during loading the App Center cache has been fixed which prevented using the App Center when the cache file was corrupted (40875).
Malformed files for meta information could cause the App Center to show a traceback. This has been fixed, those files are ignored now (40874).
Upon upgrading the App Center software package, the App cache could get outdated. This caused an error in the App Center in some cases (40882).
Improved the image gallery in the details page of an app. The handling of YouTube videos has been improved and enlarging thumbnails is smoother (39794).
A help text still mentioned the Free-for-personal-Use Edition. This has been replaced with the UCS Core Edition (38530).
The overview of software changes has been enhanced (39896).
A margin has been added to the footer buttons of the installation error page (39907).
Join scripts and unjoin scripts are now correctly removed while installing and uninstalling an App (40879).
Minor code changes make other projects easier that rely on the App Center (40943).
univention-app shell now correctly exits with the exit code of the called command (40550).
univention-app installed unsigned packages. This issue has been fixed (40861).
The Package Management module can be opened via hash again (40991).
Details of software packages can be shown again (40992).
The installation status of Docker Apps was determined incorrectly by certain functions of the App Center. This has been fixed (41009).
Join scripts of Docker Apps are run via univention-run-join-scripts instead of being called directly (40984).
The certificate of the App Center server is now always validated in HTTPS connections (30620).
When extracting new App meta data, the permissions are set explicitly for these files instead of relying on the archive (41029).
Some images were not shown in Internet Explorer. This issue has been resolved (39927).
The parameter for creating a Docker Container can now be adjusted by the App (41062).

section.title: &ucsUDM; UMC modules and command line interface

listitem.simpara: Some LDAP search requests have been optimized in the handler modules (40651).
In situations where the IP address of a created computer contained two equal blocks (e.g. 10.10.20.0/24) invalid pointer records were created. This issue has been fixed (39030).
The layout of DNS service and text records have been adjusted to be more readable (40775).

It is now prevented to create extended attributes for users with required fields without specifying a default value. Those extended attributes caused problems during upgrading to UCS 4.1 or installing various apps (40824).
The search filter for name in the dns/dns module now also finds zones and pointer records (23804).
The search filter for dhcpPermitList in the dhcp/pool lookup function has been fixed (39343).
The search filter for fqdn has been adapted so it can be used to search for multiple computers (34327).
Some columns which show more information in the grid of UMC have been added to the DNS handler modules (38639).
The error message for malformed paths in shares has been improved (41040).
Multiple modules allowed to select special Docker host objects when it came to choosing a computer object. This option has been removed as it makes no sense (41041).
importing the python modules of univention.admin doesn't depend on the order or previous imports anymore (33359).

section.title: Modules for system settings / setup wizard

listitem.simpara: Access restrictions on non DC master App Appliances have been corrected in the system activation package (39700).
App Appliances now ensure that the UCS domain they join has an activated license (39700).
The virtual keyboard to enter special characters now supports touch devices (40572).
The initial setup used a script to update the App Center files that failed under certain circumstances. Now a script is called that works in unjoined environments (40897).
The PTR record entries are now sorted numerical in the overview of a reverse zone (40747).
The DNS module now displays more information in the grid columns and forward zones are now shown before reverse zones in the tree view (38639).
Searching for a specific object type underneath of cn=univention in the LDAP directory did not yield results and has been repaired (32843).
Searching for properties which require an exact match did not work because the LDAP filter was prepended with *. The search for e.g. the gidNumber of a group is now possible again (37904).
Searching for properties using the LDAPSearch syntax class caused a traceback. This issue has been fixed (38635).
The users/self module can now be activated again via setting the &ucsUCRV; umc/module/udm/users/self/disabled to false (39016).
Performance of the UMC print quota overview has been improved (33792).
Hosts which are docker containers are now excluded from the check in the diagnostic module if the SSH connection to these hosts is possible (40563).
The preup.sh and postup.sh scripts have been updated to match UCS-4.1-2 (41157).
Linux 4.1 kernel package are now also considered for removal an upgrades (40748).

The change from HTTP to HTTPS breaks the old updater from UCS-4.0-4, which is still running after the update to 4.1-0. As such all updates stop there. Running the same command again continues installing updates, as then the new updater is used. This update fixes this problem by re-executing the updater after each update to guarantee, that the latest version is always used (40338).

The dists/**/Packages* files created for local repositories did contain multiple entries for the same package. This breaks the Debian installer and other tools like debootstrap, which use a simpler implementation than APT. A filter has been added to filter out old versions and duplicate entries (40932).
The joinscript uses cURL instead of wget to configure SAML service provider setting to prevent conflicts with old SHA-1 or MD5 SSL certificates (40658).
A unjoin-script has been added which removes the SAML configuration for UMC (40738).
The creation of the internal SAML LDAP user ignores extended attributes now (40741).
The extended attribute for the SAML service provider can now be used in user templates (40895).
The robustness and performance have been increased by not forking a UMC module process on each HTTP request (40799).
The Univention Configuration Registry variable description for kerberos/autostart did not clearly explain that this variable needs to remain set to no on Samba4/AD DCs (40383).

In case an account locking password policy has been defined for the domain, e.g. via samba-tool domain passwordsettings, the badPwdCount increased in steps of two for each failed login attempt at a Windows client (40328).
The patch for 2015-5252 caused a regression for the special share path /. This issue has been fixed (40847).

This update sets the new smb.conf option ldap server require strong auth to allow_sasl_over_tls. Additionally it configures tls verify peer to ca_and_name. The raised security requirements of Samba server components may require configuration adjustments for older clients. Univention Corporate Client (UCC) 1.0 running a Linux kernel version prior to 3.8 for example require an adjustment of the mount.cifs options. In that case the value for mount option sec needs to be adjusted to ntlmsspi, e.g. by setting ucr set ucc/mount/cifshome/options="serverino,sec=ntlmsspi". UCC 2.x clients (i.e. Linux kernel above 3.8) don't require this adjustment (40988).

This update makes additional smb.conf options configurable via Univention Configuration Registry: samba/ntlm/auth, samba/server/signing samba/tls/verify/peer samba/tls/priority samba/tls/dh/params/file and samba/ldap/server/require/strong/auth (41034).
The Active Directory takeover fails if the Active Directory NetBIOS domain name is unusual. This issue has been fixed (39070).

Support for synchronization of the OpenLDAP attribute mailAlternativeAddress with the AD attribute proxyAddresses has been added. This can be switched on for users and groups individually by the new pair of Univention Configuration Registry variables connector/ad/mapping/user/alternativemail and connector/ad/mapping/group/alternativemail (40357).
Various issues have been fixed in ucslint which checks a source package for errors (40386, 40639, 40647).
Plymouth now uses the framebuffer renderer as default (40715).
